com.defano.jmonet.canvas

Class UndoablePaintCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JScrollPane
            • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.surface.AbstractScrollableSurface
              • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.AbstractPaintCanvas
                • com.defano.jmonet.canvas.UndoablePaintCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PaintCanvas, ScalableScratchDrawable, Scrollable, Surface, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants

    public class UndoablePaintCanvas
extends BasicPaintCanvas
    A paint tools canvas with a built-in undo and redo buffer. Extends the capabilities inherit to BasicPaintCanvas.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • UndoablePaintCanvas

        public UndoablePaintCanvas()
        Creates a new PaintCanvas with a blank (transparent) initial image displayed in it.

      • UndoablePaintCanvas

        public UndoablePaintCanvas(java.awt.image.BufferedImage initialImage)
        Creates a new PaintCanvas with a given image initially displayed in it.
        Parameters:
        initialImage - The image to be displayed in the canvas.

    • Method Detail

      • undo

        public boolean undo()
        Undoes the previous committed change. Maybe called successively to revert committed changes one-by-one until the undo buffer is exhausted.
        Returns:
        True if the undo was successful, false if there are no unable changes in the buffer.

      • redo

        public boolean redo()
        Reverts the previous undo; has no effect if a commit was made following the previous undo.
        Returns:
        True if the redo was successful, false if there is no undo available to revert.

      • hasUndoableChanges

        public boolean hasUndoableChanges()
        Determines if a commit is available to be undone.
        Returns:
        True if undo() will succeed; false otherwise.

      • hasRedoableChanges

        public boolean hasRedoableChanges()
        Determines if an undo is available to revert.
        Returns:
        True if redo() will succeed; false otherwise.

      • getMaxUndoBufferDepth

        public int getMaxUndoBufferDepth()
        Gets the maximum depth of the undo buffer.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of undos that are supported by this PaintCanvas.

      • commit

        public void commit(ChangeSet changeSet)
        Commits the contents of the scratch buffer to the canvas.
        Specified by:
        commit in interface PaintCanvas
        Overrides:
        commit in class BasicPaintCanvas

      • getCanvasImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getCanvasImage()
        Renders the canvas image by successively applying each visible change in the buffer to the base, permanent image.
        Specified by:
        getCanvasImage in interface ScalableScratchDrawable
        Overrides:
        getCanvasImage in class BasicPaintCanvas
        Returns:
        An image representing the current state of the canvas.
